content.description: Start with an overhanging boulder problem to gain a ledge. Continue up and left through steep terrain to a bolted anchor.
content.location: Route starts near the taller part of the cliff at the overhang with a bolt.

content.description: Good variety in a short route with a mix of thin slab and jugs. Toprope anchor is high on another ledge left of the top bolt and can be set to do this route and the 5.7 variant of the 5.8 route to the left.
content.protection: 4 bolts to 1 high hanger with chain, 1 rap-off hanger. anchor is high and left of last bolt.
content.location: Looking straight at the cliff, identify the only anchor that is on a vertical face in the middle. This route is just right of that with 5 or so bolts that trend right toward the end.

content.description: Climb up past 3 or 4 bolts to a ledgey area, then go left on easy climbing to the bolted anchor on Catapult.
content.location: Between The Litter Box and Catapult.  Bolted line just to the right of Catapult.  The first bolt is a bit high; about 15 feet off the ground.

climbs.name: Catapult
climbs.fa: Bill Cramer, Rob Helen and Kevin Keith

content.description: Steep bouldery face climbing past several bolts.
content.protection: Four or five bolts and a chain anchor
content.location: Starts below a small roof and continues up through several overhangs to a chain anchor.

content.description: South facing sport climbing. All you need is a 60 meter rope and 10 draws.
